title: Ex-UFC star wins UK bareknuckle boxing title fight after dishing out ‘savage ass kicking’
text:
Ex-UFC star wins UK bareknuckle boxing title fight after dishing out ‘savage ass kicking’ Ex-UFC star wins UK bareknuckle boxing title fight after dishing out ‘savage ass kicking’ UFC veteran Joe Riggs took a break from the world of MMA to hone his skills in the boxing ring, competing in a bareknuckle fight in the UK this month. / Published 8th February 2017 
Still only 34, the hardman – nicknamed Diesel – already has 60 mixed martial arts fights under his belt, with two victories in his last three bouts. 
But the US-based welterweight brawler decided to ditch the gloves for some old-fashioned fighting across the pond, taking on Christian Evans in a bareknuckle title fight. 
Stepping up to light heavyweight for the clash, Riggs controlled the fight throughout but struggled to reign in his MMA instincts during the initial exchanges. 
YOUTUBE Former UFC star Joe Riggs floors his rival during the bareknuckle boxing title fight 
He was deducted points in the first two rounds after trying to takedown Evans but rallied in the third, knocking his rival down with a looping right hand that sent Evans crashing to the mat with a nasty cut above his eye. 
Riggs pressed ahead and used his superior fight IQ in the latter stages of the bout to take home the title via unanimous decision. 
It’s not clear whether Riggs will kick on with his bareknuckle career or head back to MMA – but fans are clearly hoping to see more of 42-17 fighter in the ring. 
“Diesels been fighting forever he's a beast can't wait to see how he gets on in bareknuckle boxing,” wrote one supporter. 
YOUTUBE The 34-year-old scooped the title via unanimous decision Who are the current UFC champions? Wednesday, 18th January 2017 THESE fighters are the reigning champs in their weight categories. 1 / 11 Women's strawweight: Joanna Jedrzejczyk 
Another viewer said: “Great fight. I like Joe Riggs here. 
“Been a fan of his for years, not sure why the commentators thought it was close? It was an ass kicking by Riggs.” 
The clip comes after footage emerged from Miami, Florida, lifting the lid on the murky world of unregulated bareknuckle boxing that gave rise to MMA icons like Kimbo Slice and Jorge Masvidal. Related articles
